history.content: I was going to say "see @438" but then realized you are the author of that post. Whoops. FWIW this looks correct to me.

children.subject:
Ha np.

Yeah i made that post too but i didn't include both weeks in the old post; also I listed the sections by name here as well as the omitted sections. I am hoping this way (listing the section names) it makes it easier for an authority to quickly look at it and say "yeah" or "nah".
Unable to delete my worthless student answer, sorry about that.
Its not officially, BUT its listed as the source of some of the HW problems from last week; so, by proxy, we had to read it (possibly; it may be possible to rely mostly on the lecture too).
Gotcha. I see the topics and I agree that we needed to know that stuff. I just couldn't find it in the reading list. Thanks for putting this together.

I don't see any references to DPV chapter 4 in the lecture schedule. 

https://8803ga.wordpress.com/lecture-schedule/
I agree; DPV 4.6 esp Bellman-Ford pp118-119
Uh oh, I only vaguely remember that from gr4. We aren't being tested on that right?

I think the videos are DP Shortest Paths, that we should already have understood, so some reference to it may be included; the fact that it is in the relevant book chapter should be an indication it's the kind of DP topic we need to remember for the impending test.

history.content:
Hi All,

I am trying to put together a reading list for exam 2, but am a bit confused as to the relevant subsections in the chapters.  These are the ones I know of - are there more?

ch3: All sections


ch4: Paths in Graphs

4.1 Distances

4.2 Breadth-First Search

4.3 Lengths on Edges

4.4 Dijkstra's Algorithm

4.5 Priority Queue Implementations

4.7 Shortest Path in Dags

ch5: Greedy Algorithms

5.1 Minimum Spanning Trees

ch7: Linear Programming and Reductions

7.2: Flows In Networks

The above is what I believe we need to have read; below are the subsections in the chapters I think we do not have to read:

ch4:

4.6 Shortest Paths In the Presence of Negative Numbers

ch5:

5.2 Huffman Encoding

5.3 Horn Formulas

5.4 Set Cover

ch7:

7.1 An Introduction To Linear Programming

7.3 Bipartite Matching

7.4 Duality

7.5 Zero-Sum Games

7.6 The Simplex Algorithm

7.7 Postscript: Circuit Evaluation

Am I correct?

Thanks,

Brent
